header.title: Namespace Document for Map Functions used in XPath 3.1, XQuery 3.1, and XSLT 3.0

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p:
This document describes the namespace &nsname; defined by the
specification (&xslt.spec.date.month; &xslt.spec.date.year; version) as well as the specification (&fo.spec.date.month; &fo.spec.date.year; version). This namespace is identified by the namespace prefix map:, which is not a predefined prefix. For updated information, please refer to the latest version of the and specifications.

This document describes the names that are defined in this namespace at the time of publication. The W3C reserves the right to define additional names in this namespace in the future. and are the only specifications that may amend this namespace, and the intention is to keep them aligned, though there may be timing differences between publications.
This document contains a directory of links to related resources, using RDDL (as defined in ).
It is GRDDL-enabled (as defined in ), that is to say that a GRDDL-compliant processor can extract useful RDF (as defined in ) representations of the information contained herein.

div1.head: Map Functions
div1.p: This section lists all of the functions defined by the specification to be in the namespace reserved for certain functions operating on maps. Each function is uniquely identified with a URI of the form: “&nsname;#name” where name is the name of a function, such as “get”: &nsname;#get.

The normative definitions of these functions are in the specification. For convenience, a very brief, non-normative summary of each function is provided. For details, follow the link on the “Summary:” introductory text below each function.
